channel.title: Moving this fro Max to Axoloti
channel.description: Hi Guys, I would like to implement the below Max snippet somewow in Axoloti, if it is possible. Is is basically an AM modulator, I use this as my own ac encoder, my own "Silent Way" plug-in, if I can say. With my active AC encoder module in my modular, I can convert 0-1 floating signals from Max into 0-10 volts. As you can see, the bas is a 22050 Hz sine oscillator, which is modulated by a floating point number, from other devices, sequencers, etc. Is it possible to implement this somehow?

item.title: Moving this fro Max to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @toneburst alx
item.description:
@toneburst wrote:

You'd probably need to use a 24kHz oscillator in Axolotl-world (assuming the osc frequency is exactly half the sample-rate).

a|x

Read full topic
item.source: Moving this fro Max to Axoloti

item.title: Moving this fro Max to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @snaper snaper
item.description:
@snaper wrote:

Hi Guys,

I would like to implement the below Max snippet somewow in Axoloti, if it is possible.
Is is basically an AM modulator, I use this as my own ac encoder, my own "Silent Way" plug-in, if I can say.
With my active AC encoder module in my modular, I can convert 0-1 floating signals from Max into 0-10 volts.

As you can see, the bas is a 22050 Hz sine oscillator, which is modulated by a floating point number, from other devices, sequencers, etc.

Is it possible to implement this somehow?

Read full topic
item.source: Moving this fro Max to Axoloti
